snippet: A judge said that RIM and Apple had not violated Kodak’s patent for digital image-preview technology, because the patent was invalid.
abstract: International Trade Commission Judge Thomas Pender says that Research in Motion and Apple did not violate Kodak’s patent for digital image-preview technology, because the patent was invalid; decision may hurt the value of assets Kodak is selling in bankruptcy.

headline.main: Kodak Loses Patent Case Against Apple and RIM
headline.print_headline: Kodak Loses a Ruling in a Patent Case Against Apple and RIM

snippet: The British designer Max Lamb creates beautiful one-of-a-kind furniture from natural materials discovered in remote locations.
abstract: The British designer Max Lamb creates beautiful one-of-a-kind furniture from natural materials discovered in remote locations.

snippet: Recovering alcoholics can now access various apps on mobile devices to track progress and connect with others in their situation.
abstract: Mobile application developed by the Hazelden Foundation gives alcoholics interactive access to the 12 steps, along with several other tools for battling their addiction.

headline.main: Sobriety Tools That Fit in a Pocket
headline.print_headline: Sobriety Tools That Fit in a Pocket

snippet: Wyatt Mason picks his eight favorite songs by Regina Spektor.
abstract: Wyatt Mason picks his eight favorite songs by Regina Spektor.

headline.main: The Eight Best Songs by Regina Spektor

snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index, where Apple accounts for 4 percent, had its best day in nearly five weeks.
abstract: Stocks rise, helped by Apple's 5.8 percent share climb.

headline.main: Propelled by Apple, Markets Post Gains After a Losing Week
headline.print_headline: Propelled by Apple, Markets Post Gains After a Losing Week

snippet: Thanks to a setting in iTunes, fans of opera and "Abbey Road" do not have to hear seconds of silence between selections.
abstract: Thanks to a setting in iTunes, fans of opera and "Abbey Road" do not have to hear seconds of silence between selections.

headline.main: Q&A: Making iTunes Ignore the Gap

snippet: All sorts of private Internet communications were casually scooped up as Google Street View cars photographed the world’s streets.
abstract: Google, facing a high-stakes antitrust assault in Europe and the United States, remains tight-lipped about the enormous trove of personal data it has gathered through its Street View service and other projects; German regulators have forced the company to admit that its Street View vehicles had been sweeping up data from encrypted wireless networks, but a full regulatory accounting of the project has yet to occur. Diagrams, Photos (M)

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and KEVIN J. O'BRIEN; Steve Lohr and Edward Wyatt contributed reporting

snippet: The Federal Communications Commission is considering giving online distributors like Hulu and YouTube the same rights and responsibilities enjoyed by cable companies.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission is considering whether to apply regulations designed for cable television providers to online distributors like Hulu and YouTube; shift would allow online companies to distribute a greater number of popular TV shows to computers and smartphones. Photos (M)

headline.main: If Video Sites Could Act Like Cable Companies

snippet: Marlon Rivera’s satire “The Woman in the Septic Tank” follows ambitous young moviemakers who live a life of privilege in Manila but want to make an exploitative film about poverty.
abstract: Rachel Saltz reviews movie The Woman in the Septic Tank, directed by Marlon Rivera; Kean Cipriano and J M de Guzman star. Photo (M)

headline.main: Let's Film These Poor People; Maybe We'll Get Rich

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: THE WOMAN IN THE SEPTIC TANK (MOVIE)

snippet: Though New York’s starred chefs could dine anywhere, many choose straightforward fare when they kick back.
abstract: New York's starred chefs could dine anywhere, and certainly proprietors of New York's most distinguished restaurants would personally cook anything for them, but many culinary luminaries choose straightforward fare when they relax; favoring the casual and even the simple, they frequently return to the same couple of places and order the same thing, again and again. Photos (M)

headline.main: Follow a Hungry Chef and See Where It Takes You
